abstract: An object that provides text that a tooltip displays instead of the default text.

overview:
## Discussion

To provide tooltip text based on the current state or unique logic of your app, set the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIToolTipInteraction/delegate] property to an object that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIToolTipInteractionDelegate] protocol and implements the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIToolTipInteractionDelegate/toolTipInteraction(_:configurationAt:)] method. The method returns a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIToolTipConfiguration] object containing the text to display in the tooltip. For example, the following code listing instructs the tooltip to show the name of the view’s background color instead of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIToolTipInteraction/defaultToolTip] text. If the color name is unavailable, the method returns `nil`, which disables the display of the tooltip.
